website_summaries.verdict: Realistic details like broken shackles and her flowing robe make Lady Liberty an iconic focal point in your home or office.
pros: With 1,685 pieces, this impressive replica towers more than 17” high
Features statue, crown, golden torch and highly detailed pedestal
Recommended for builders age 16 and up
cons: The face does not have much detail

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful set in a really fun series.
customer_reviews.text: This is an absolutely beautiful architecture set. Some other builders have stated that they don’t like that there isn’t more detail in the face; I agree that it could look better to have some, but I don’t feel it detracts from the simple beauty of this set. I really enjoyed this one, as I build the architecture series of places that I (and/or my family) have seen. This one is different from the others in that it really gives height to the set, which allows for the folds of fabric in the statue to be seen and explored. Just a lot of fun to build, and I think this one will definitely get many comments. Kudos, LEGO !
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy C.

customer_reviews.title: Loved it!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves this!! It took her 3 good days of work to finish it (she’s 10). I was worried it would be too challenging but it was very repetitive in design and I think that’s how she got through it as easily as she did. The only complaint we might have is that we wish it had a face.
customer_reviews.author: Missy V.

customer_reviews.title: My first Lego kit
customer_reviews.text: I always thought that Lego bricks were for kids, but then I saw this Statue of Liberty kit and had to have it (I'm somewhat of a huge Statue of LIberty fan). I enjoyed making this kit -- the design is well thought-out, and the bricks mesh with eachother with a very satisfactory, almost sensual precision. I now understand what all the fuss is with Lego blocks. This won't be my last kit.
customer_reviews.author: SoCal guy

customer_reviews.title: One of the best in the series
customer_reviews.text: One of the best in the series. My only criticism is the lack of any detail in the face but the rest of it is fantastic. It is also much larger than expected and dwarfs most of the other sets
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: Not cheap and missing pieces..
customer_reviews.text: My son at 21 is an lego expert. Out gamily xmas tradition is every year for him to build an expert lego.. first yime ever missing pieces... he is ver particular and unhappy.. i was going to get thevtaj mahal next and i am concerned. 3 x 6221729 and 1 x 6202626 the puctures show it completed but with the wrong itens in too many 6221730 and not enough of other .... most upsetting.
customer_reviews.author: mickey onyett

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful model with some pieces missing
customer_reviews.text: I had to order a couple of packages of small pieces when those came up short. Still, I would do it all again in a minute. You learn a lot doing Lady Liberty. Did you know about the broken chains at the Lady's feet? They are the last pieces you put on the model. They caused me to decide to read and learn more about her history.
customer_reviews.author: JAB

customer_reviews.title: I enjoyed the clear construction instructions
customer_reviews.text: Every home needs a little Lady Liberty....I managed to build this in a few days as I got caught up in the progress and watching it get closer to it's final construction. It's an impressive piece, and stands quite tall, so it will become a focal point of any room. I enjoyed the clear construction instructions, and only needs to pry apart errant pieces on a very rare occasion. It's a wonderful piece by LEGO, and I highly recommend it for Lego Enthusiasts.
customer_reviews.author: M. Merritt

customer_reviews.title: Great for a Lego, New York, architecture, or history fan!
customer_reviews.text: This is Lego, so you should already know it's a premium product with a premium price tag. I paid about $96 which is fair in my eyes. The build is really fun, but about 70% of it is the pedestal. The lack of face works for me; Modders have tried a brick-built face that looks like an Easter Island statue and I feel a printed face would have looked unsettling. The instructions give some great history and cool facts about the real statue! Pick one up for yourself or someone you know who is a fan of cool architecture!
customer_reviews.author: Jason S.

customer_reviews.title: Easily Falls Apart
customer_reviews.text: The engineers at Lego must be getting lazy. Building this statue is o.k. (if you've got all the pieces: I had to send away to Lego for missing ones) until you get to the Torch. Now the rest of the build was not remarkable, or easy, which was made more difficult by poorly written instructions on glossy black paper. But the Torch is the worst. When you put it in, 2 or 3 other pieces fall off, and then the torch itself falls apart when you try to adjust it so that it looks right. There is more I could say, but I've got to get back to building.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Greve

customer_reviews.title: My Grandson LOVES It
customer_reviews.text: My grandson was feeling down because of the pandemic and of course Grammy needed to cheer him up, soooo, I bought him this LEGO set. He was in heaven. The more pieces the better he likes it. I gave it four stars on Value for Money because I think LEGO charges way too much for these things, but anything that makes my grandchildren happy always gets five stars. (You think LEGO knows that?)
customer_reviews.author: Blue Mountain

customer_reviews.title: A Fun one!
customer_reviews.text: I've completed several complex LEGO models and the SOL is tops. Clever use of the bricks to create architectural details of the base. Be warned: the model uses lots of the tiniest pieces which require careful handling (several pieces squirted across the room when i rushed the assembly -- and had to find them before the dog did). The kit uses separate bags -- 5 sets -- which makes assembly easier. No pieces missing. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Roxies_Dad

customer_reviews.title: Fun Build
customer_reviews.text: I wrote a long review that got deleted... *sigh... Fun build, kept me interested as it developed in neat and unexpected ways, came out beautifully. All of these more advanced Lego models are brilliant. I've started a growing collection that will continue to expand as long as Lego keeps making them. Absolutely love them. Saturn V, Lunar Lander, Statue of Liberty... maybe Ford Mustang next? Not sure. Finding one you like is part of the fun.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Conway

customer_reviews.title: nice build
customer_reviews.text: Lego shorted me three pieces. You can contact Lego and they will ship you missing pieces. I managed to find some in my extra pieces. One was not the part I needed but no one will notice but me.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia F Green

customer_reviews.title: Love lego architecture kits!
customer_reviews.text: My oldest son loves these lego architecture kits. They are really quite unique in the "legosphere" that is full of star wars spaceships, minecraft, planes, trains and trucks. We have plenty of these sets, most of them are beautiful (some are tiny and a bit disappointing) but this one looks gorgeous and at 1600+ pieces it will take him a while to build.
customer_reviews.author: Ofer

customer_reviews.title: Nice Lego... completed by eight-year-old
customer_reviews.text: Not sure why this says it’s for 16-year-olds or older only... My eight-year-old son finished it over the course of two days with only a few hours each day put on this Lego. He’s had harder Legos than this one with a lower age requirement. He did enjoyed it and even drew a face on it since I didn’t have a face. It is a nice LEGO but the age requirement is nonsense... challenge your kids!
customer_reviews.author: Ali S.

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to Lego architect series.
customer_reviews.text: Great way to pass a rainy day. Step by step instructions are easy to follow. All pieces conne in numbered bags coinciding with each step of assembly. I also purchased a light kit for this build which you can see in one of the photos that was NOT included with this Lego set. The instruction booklet is also informative, you learn a bit of the history behind the statue as your building it. Great set for children and adults alike.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Y

customer_reviews.title: fun build
customer_reviews.text: This is a good and surprisingly intricate build of the statue of liberty. That said, for the price I think there are better kits like the Saturn V, which is larger and much more impressive, and sturdier too. On the other hand, this isn't as tall and won't fall over easily, so it probably would be a better desk model.
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: Very nice project!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to challenge my fourth grade granddaughter who is gifted (the product said for ages 16 and up). She had it finished in two hours. She is a Legos freak.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa G.

customer_reviews.title: Sold as new but used garbage
customer_reviews.text: Returning this today Came in like a piece of garbage Box broken in 4 places and taped together
customer_reviews.author: RM

customer_reviews.title: Awesome design and build
customer_reviews.text: As a major lego fan I am happy to admit that I love this architecture design set. Even though it was pricy it was worth it for the build. The design closely resembles the Statue of Liberty and is very sturdy as there are many supports throughout the build. Definitely a great purchase and will definitely buy more lego architecture sets in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Avi

customer_reviews.title: Good build except for the face
customer_reviews.text: This is a good build with lots of pieces. As others have mentioned, the total lack of facial features is a really bummer. Also, there are a TON of small pieces which is why the piece count is a lot higher than other LEGO builds of similar size. I think the price per size is a bit high, especially with the face being blank.
customer_reviews.author: R. Grand

customer_reviews.title: Missin
customer_reviews.text: I love the architecture series and the Statue of Liberty. i previously gave them a three Star rating as I was missing pieces. I called Lego and the representative was very helpful sending me new pieces. Today I found the missing bag of missing pieces and I apologize to Lego. Lego is an excellent product and the service is wonderful. No one comes close to Lego.
customer_reviews.author: jae

customer_reviews.title: Quarantine Project
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I bought this for ourselves before we went into lockdown. This was a good lego build, complexity wise, for adults. I'm sure an older child could do it with some help as well. It took about 3-4 hours to put together and now sits in our living room. Overall it makes a decent decoration!
customer_reviews.author: Rachael

customer_reviews.title: Good Price for this Architecture Lego product
customer_reviews.text: Good price for this product! It arrived just in time as a birthday gift for the recipient. Personally, I think Legos are always extremely overpriced, but, for this one, it was excellent in price compared to other retailers. Also, it arrived just in time.
customer_reviews.author: Swedish Skier

customer_reviews.title: tho you wont know right away.....beware of missing pieces
customer_reviews.text: quality was great, but ended up missing several pieces, forcing me to compromise the book.
customer_reviews.author: Cody S Hummel

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Architecture set with lazy face design
customer_reviews.text: This is a really great Architecture set. Building it was short but fun. What I liked: highly detailed pedestal base & nice curves on body. What I didn’t like: lazy flat face design (I swapped some pieces to make it look a bit better, see pics) & torch arm could be a bit better, it doesn’t look right.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Betts

customer_reviews.title: A  small statue
customer_reviews.text: This was a birthday gift, our Granddaughter loved putting it together, looks similar to picture, our disappointment was how small it looks, I know measurements were on site, but must have overlooked them.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Great Birthday gift
customer_reviews.text: My grandson turned 13 in August. He has always loved the challenge of the bigger Lego projects. This was on the top of his wish list. He finished it in under 4 and 1/2 hours, Loved the challenge.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: All pieces present and accounted for.
customer_reviews.text: All pieces were included. My 15 year old grandson loved it and completed it in one day. It was kind of expensive for one days entertainment but he is displaying it in his room.
customer_reviews.author: Decorator

customer_reviews.title: Missing pieces
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my husband for Christmas and he set it up and it was missing 3 pieces. We triple checked all the bags and everything and it was missing pieces that were showing when LEGO set is displayed. He loves the set, but was super disappointed to have missing pieces.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful product
customer_reviews.text: This product was a Christmas gift for my 13 year old who loves legos. She absolutely loved it and spent her Christmas break building it. The lady liberty is proudly displayed in her room.
customer_reviews.author: Suruchi Khan

customer_reviews.title: Intricate & enjoyable
customer_reviews.text: This set is challenging and very enjoyable. Lovely and large structure. Took a few of hours to complete.
customer_reviews.author: Milkman

customer_reviews.title: Legos are good, they are just way too expensive!
customer_reviews.text: We have always bought Legos for our son for Christmas. I don't think we will next year as they are just so expensive! It has become silly how expensive they are.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: For the Lego Lover
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my high school son and he really enjoyed putting this together. Probably took him about 4 hours. It is a really cool piece and quite large.
customer_reviews.author: AZMom

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice Lego piece to do. Haven't gotten it assembled yet but it will look nice when completed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Missing steps in the manual
customer_reviews.text: This kit is expensive for such a small statue and a few errors in the manual we had to take pieces from out spare LEGO sets in order to finish the design. Needs 8 more pieces between step 28 and 29 to successfully build the statue.
customer_reviews.author: Total100%

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: My 8 year old grandson really enjoyed this lego set. It was educational as well as fun. It caused a great deal of discussion about our lady liberty!
customer_reviews.author: Leslie B. Palmieri

customer_reviews.title: Very cool!
customer_reviews.text: Really cool assembled. Some pieces were missing but they were on the inside of the structure so we made due and used legos from other sets.
customer_reviews.author: Public Name 2

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful set
customer_reviews.text: My 12 year old put it together in no time, but it is beautiful. Will be a nice set that will grow with him instead of $100 that will be broken down into the infamous box of a million Legos.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle K Mattingly

customer_reviews.title: Another great Lego!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my granddaughter‘s 10th birthday and she loved it! She loves Lego and this was a great challenge for her! She did not stop until this project was complete.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: It’s a great set/decoration, but it has some flaws
customer_reviews.text: It’s 100% worth the time to build it, and in the end it turns out to be a foot and a half! It’s super detailed, but some of the places are weak and easy to disassemble if you need to. It’s a great edition to a room and took about 2.5 days by me (13yrs old) But BE CAREFUL! It’s pretty too heavy despite the support beams on the inside. Overall I would say a 4 star set, -1 star because it gets repetitive at times and you could get bored
customer_reviews.author: KIMBERLY

customer_reviews.title: Its nice
customer_reviews.text: It's nice and looks good I gave it onkyb4 stars because it was missing some critical pieces
customer_reviews.author: bill

customer_reviews.title: Is it easy to assemble I don't know but my grandson can put it together in a little while
customer_reviews.text: My grandson enjoys putting legos together and it looks great once he did, this is great for kids to work assemble and feel proud about themselves
customer_reviews.author: Arturo Gonzales

customer_reviews.title: Looks awesome
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the largest sets in thr architecture line. It is over a foot tall and looks great. It has become the centerpiece of our collection.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Kept two boys busy all Christmas Day!
customer_reviews.text: Gift for 10 year old boy who spent Christmas Day putting it together while his 15 year old cousin put together the Empire State model. Both boys were very proud of their one day completed projects!
customer_reviews.author: Jan Newman

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Gift
customer_reviews.text: My 13 yr old loves it! Of course it’s not supposed to be Easy, it’s an architectural LEGO set. I would definitely recommend getting the corresponding light kit with it. The lights bring Ms. Liberty to life and make for a perfect night light to avoid other LEGO pieces on the floor. I just wouldn’t recommend leaving the light on all night (for safety purposes).
customer_reviews.author: heather willcox

customer_reviews.title: BUY THIS!
customer_reviews.text: I’m buying two more of these to keep on my shelf for later! Incredible build and displays great! Make sure you check out the face mod by JK Brickworks!
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Boccia

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely perfect! I love it
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely perfect! I love it! It was a blast to build. Somewhere I screwed up and had to take the statue apart and rebuild (due to a missing part). I still couldn't find it, so I switched one 'unseen inner' for another, to compensate.
customer_reviews.author: jdub39

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: OMG, what a great build. Oh, and the history in the assembling manual. I love LEGOs
customer_reviews.author: Ronny

customer_reviews.title: Great build
customer_reviews.text: Great looking build. The only flaw is the lack of a face on Lady Liberty.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen B. Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Vivid set
customer_reviews.text: a great representation of the iconic spot at NYC. love the set.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Product.
customer_reviews.text: My boys (14 yr old twins) enjoyed putting this together. The older of the two loves all Statue of Liberty collectibles.
customer_reviews.author: Denise L Christensen

customer_reviews.title: Lego Statue of Liberty
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift and was told it looks great against his other architectural Lego kits
customer_reviews.author: Dennis

customer_reviews.title: Statue of Liberty
customer_reviews.text: Final assembly of the arm, torch and crown is quite irritating as the pieces are not overlapped enough to create strong bonds SO they do fall off very easily. My son is a long term seasoned lego builder so he was very patient with it. I was more irritated.
customer_reviews.author: SLa Haise

customer_reviews.title: Brand new -Came with missing pieces
customer_reviews.text: WE eagerly began working on this cool new Lego only to find that pieces in package 2 were incorrect. Instead of containing 16 of the pieces 4579260, there were 16 of the 4113915 pieces. Went to the Lego website and error message kept coming up when trying to put in my zip code. So much extra work after paying a pretty penny for this set.
customer_reviews.author: Marigold

customer_reviews.title: Enjoyed assembling and putting it in place
customer_reviews.text: Excellent piece I think it fits furniture well too. Worth the buying experience! It arrived fast shipping.
customer_reviews.author: Bravo

customer_reviews.title: All thing good
customer_reviews.text: I enjoy doing puzzles and building models so this was great and also patriotic.
customer_reviews.author: Intrested in All Things

customer_reviews.title: Christmas gift for 8 year old.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for an 8 year old Lego lover who loves all things NYC. He finished it all by himself. He said there is a lot of detail to it ...and the base is bigger than his head. I haven’t seen it in person yet (see photo he texted me) , but, I guess it’s quite big. Needless to say, he loved it.
customer_reviews.author: undertheradar7323

customer_reviews.title: LEGO Statue of Liberty
customer_reviews.text: Amazing design! Super fun to build, great for any LEGO collector, any age
customer_reviews.author: Vito

customer_reviews.title: Great buy for LEGO Architecture Collectors
customer_reviews.text: The Statue of Liberty set is a great display piece. The box was packaged nicely and is in good condition to keep as a collectible. I’d love if the next LEGO Architecture Statue of Liberty had more detail in the facial area. Keep the Architecture models coming, LEGO.
customer_reviews.author: Chloe Ward

customer_reviews.title: Good set
customer_reviews.text: My 13 year old loved putting this together. It took him about 3 days doing it casually.
customer_reviews.author: Jennie

customer_reviews.title: Great kit!
customer_reviews.text: Was a gift for a nephew ... it’s beautiful assembled.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: great detail
customer_reviews.text: even has her back foot lifted in walking motion! bought for my 10yr old lego-obsessed son, but we all love it so much it sits proudly in our front room for everyone to appreciate.
customer_reviews.author: Valeri MH

customer_reviews.title: Statue of Liberty
customer_reviews.text: The Lego Architecture Statue of Liberty is a beautiful piece to have! I gave it to my son as a birthday present and he couldn't wait to put it together in 1.5 days :)
customer_reviews.author: gloria martinez

customer_reviews.title: Solid. Recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Smaller than original but still worth the money. Another LEGO win.
customer_reviews.author: Captain Caveman

customer_reviews.title: Nice set.
customer_reviews.text: My grandson has several of the architecture sets. He had this built in a day by himself.
customer_reviews.author: Patti in TX

customer_reviews.title: One of Lego best Architectural models!
customer_reviews.text: Loved the model ... built just before going to see the Statute in person. Was a great Lego and travel experience.
customer_reviews.author: RDM Indiana

customer_reviews.title: A fairly decent reproduction
customer_reviews.text: It has high quality parts like all Lego products with a novel design assembly. The face of Liberty is a bit disappointing...it is simply flat and distorted. Otherwise a very nice design.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Christmas present!
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my 13 year old son for Christmas. He loved it! He was able to do it in a day and a half. It's on the shelf in his room and his saving his money so that he can buy the light set that goes with it.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Delong

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Bought for grandson for the holidays. Didn’t give it to him yet but I’m sure he’ll love it.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Rosenberg

customer_reviews.title: Very Detailed
customer_reviews.text: I enjoyed this LEGO very much. I built it in about 4 hours and it looked exactly like the photo of it. I was very suprised that it was ages 16+ because I’m just 11. I liked it very much.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Yay LEGO’s
customer_reviews.text: Legos rock. My nephew was super happy with his gift!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Great gift for 12 year old
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my 12 year old grandson so he would have something to do that was challenging. He finished it in about 5 hours.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Allen

customer_reviews.title: Great lego set!
customer_reviews.text: Really fun build and bigger then I thought it would be!
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Exactly As Expected
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't be happier with this purchase! I was on the hunt for something to destress from work and took my time building this model over multiple evenings. All in all, I'd say I spent 8hrs total on it.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Killian Pieszchalski

customer_reviews.title: Another great
customer_reviews.text: What can i say, its Lego. Was fun to put together. Love the size of this one.
customer_reviews.author: Life is good

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Price!
customer_reviews.text: I cant wait to build this! It came super quick
customer_reviews.author: Erik Cruz

customer_reviews.title: Fun and Pretty
customer_reviews.text: Putting together this LEGO Architecture Statue of Liberty was really fun. The directions are very clear. Final production looks awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Worst of all LEGO sets I’ve built
customer_reviews.text: The pieces don’t go together the way the 100 other LEGO sets we have. Stupid design!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kman003

customer_reviews.title: Used product
customer_reviews.text: I opened the box and the pieces were literally in two zip lock bags
customer_reviews.author: sal

customer_reviews.title: Detailed and striking
customer_reviews.text: Really nice set for 9 year old who visited the statue and keeps it on display as a souvenir. He worked on it for about 5 hours.
customer_reviews.author: A. Tex

customer_reviews.title: It would have been 5 stars, but....
customer_reviews.text: This is not my first Lego Architecture set, and I’ve enjoyed building the ones I own, so imagine my surprise (and chagrin) when I discovered that this set was missing parts!! (Now you know why it’s 4 stars and not 5....)
customer_reviews.author: SC

customer_reviews.title: really neat
customer_reviews.text: Comes apart really easily so you have to be really careful with it once it is together but it is really neat. My 9 year old put it together, so I have it on my desk at work.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: My grandson likes it. Didn’t take him long to complete it. May have to get LEGO that is more challenging.
customer_reviews.author: Bascokid

customer_reviews.title: Loved it
customer_reviews.text: Great little project and much cheaper than the 2foot high one.
customer_reviews.author: Tio

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I love the box! Everything with the instruction manual inside. Also it is something you can use to relax your mind.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Always lego
customer_reviews.text: Very hard one, but I liked it. One more for my collection.
customer_reviews.author: DAVI

customer_reviews.title: Great Lego build
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic Lego build. I finished this up over 2 days, and really enjoyed how it came together.
customer_reviews.author: Michael McVay

customer_reviews.title: Grandson Christmas
customer_reviews.text: Put this together during their Christmas break - loves legos!!!
customer_reviews.author: Zenobia W. Ledford

customer_reviews.title: A little pricey but worth the purchase
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my son for Christmas. As soon as he opened it, he dove in and didn’t stop until it was complete. The price on all LEGO kits are a little steep but, this one was worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: How to Get Your Kids Off Video Games!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my grandson for his 14th birthday thinking it would take him awhile to complete it. It had 1600+ pieces. It took him 24 hours to do it, but it kept him off the tv playing his games!
customer_reviews.author: southern grandma 7

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: My boy loved it! It was very intricate and a great replica of the real thing.
customer_reviews.author: jarrod t bischel

customer_reviews.title: Great set
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for a 20 year old LEGO fan.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Awesome. My 11 year old daughter was able to complete this. Very realistic too.
customer_reviews.author: Kim Keever

customer_reviews.title: Lego
customer_reviews.text: Arrived as promised.. This is a birthday present in February..
customer_reviews.author: Patricia McGrogan

customer_reviews.title: Nice Kit for Adult LEGO Fans
customer_reviews.text: Birthday gift for my spouse. He loved assembling this statue. Good challenge for a Lego fan.
customer_reviews.author: Michael A. Culver

customer_reviews.title: Fun for the whole family
customer_reviews.text: I love the product, however it is missing at least one piece so far 1/2 through the build. Once finished, who should I contact to have the piece/pieces sent to me?
customer_reviews.author: Michael Wilkie

customer_reviews.title: Great gift.
customer_reviews.text: Our 10-year-old grandson was thrilled with his gift. Much larger than expected. The gift has inspired our grandson to research information on the statue.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cool LEGO
customer_reviews.text: Challenging enough for my 9 year old daughter and her mother
customer_reviews.author: Raul Duque Sanchez

customer_reviews.title: It's beautiful!
customer_reviews.text: This is my first Lego architecture. I'm definitely plan on getting another in the series.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Mansfield

product_meta.title: LEGO Architecture Statue of Liberty 21042 Building Kit (1685 Pieces)
product_meta.description: Celebrate a monumental blend of architecture and sculpture with this LEGO Architecture 21042 The Statue of Liberty set. America’s iconic symbol of freedom stands more than 305 feet above Liberty Island in New York harbor, welcoming seafarers from around the globe. This impressive LEGO interpretation faithfully reproduces the monument’s harmonious blend of sculpture and architecture with its intricately detailed shield-lined pedestal, brick detailing and columned balconies. The beautifully crafted Lady Liberty statue features a flowing robe, broken shackles, 7-ray crown, iconic tablet and an upraised arm bearing a golden torch. Finished with an authentic sand-green and beige color scheme, and a decorative nameplate, this model delivers a highly satisfying building experience to all with an interest in architecture, travel, history and design, and makes a truly symbolic centerpiece for the home or office.
feature_bullets: Bring a symbolic centerpiece to your home or office with this Statue of Liberty model
Delivers a rewarding building experience to all with an interest in architecture, travel, history and design
Features a detailed pedestal and iconic Lady Liberty statue complete with crown and golden torch
Statue of Liberty model measures over 17-inch (44cm) high, 5-inch (14cm) wide and 5-inch (14cm) deep
1,685 pieces – For boys and girls over 16 years old

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item is not eligible for international shipping. Learn More
